title: MSRV: pin url@2.5.0 in CI
body: cc https://github.com/servo/rust-url/issues/937

title: fix: don't enable hyper-rustls/http2 unless http2 is already enabled
body: Introduced by #2299

title: Don't compile hyper-tls with native-roots unless rustls-tls-native-roots is enabled
body:
I noticed when using `rustls-tls-no-provider` that I was still pulling in `openssl-probe` as a dependency through `rustls-native-certs` through `hyper-rustls` even though (I assume) it is entirely unused.

Moving that feature to be optionally enabled seems to work fine

title: test: add http3 test server support
fix http3 compilation if http2 is disabled
Opt into ringless behavior
body:
Add a feature rustls-tls-no-provider to build reqwest with rustls but without a default provider. This will deliberately panic if no global provider is set. The feature is "additive" with the rustls-tls feature in the sense that it will simply default to ring rather than panicking if both are enabled

This is accomplished by conditionally enabling `ring` features on dependencies through a new internal __rustls-ring feature, which is enabled in all cases where `ring` was previously used

title: feat: upgrade to rustls 0.23
body:
Smaller version of #2225. This doesn't provide maximum configurability, just updates to the newest. More configuration can be added in new PRs.

There's one piece that perhaps should be included here: instead of always picking the ring backend, we could use `default_provider().unwrap_or_else(ring_provider)`, as was mentioned in #2225.

cc @djc

title: Add `from_parts` and `build_split` methods to `blocking::RequestBuilder` struct
body:
Hello,

I needed these two methods for a project and noticed that they were missing when using the `blocking` feature.
I am not sure why that was the case so if there was a reason feel free to reject the PR and tell me why 🙏.

title: chore: update sync_wrapper to 1.0
body:
This updates `sync_wrapper` to its latest version (`1.0.1`).

Ref: https://github.com/Actyx/sync_wrapper/compare/v0.1.2...v1.0.1

title: Update cookie crates
body:
Basically the same as https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/2089.
This is one step towards dropping the `idna` `v0.3` duplication (vs. `v0.5`) from our codebase, along with https://github.com/rushmorem/publicsuffix/pull/40.

title: Fix incorrect Accept-Encoding header combinations in Accepts::as_str
body: This pull request addresses a bug in the `Accepts::as_str` method where incorrect header combinations were returned for certain configurations. Specifically, the method incorrectly included 'zstd' in some combinations where it should not have been.

title: refactor: blocking feature doesn't need multi-threaded tokio runtime
Add an implementation for RequestBuilder::from_parts and RequestBuilder::build_split for wasm targets
body:
Currently, the implementation of `RequestBuilder` for WASM targets lacks an implementation of `RequestBuilder::from_parts` and `RequestBuilder::build_split`. I noticed this when the latest version of `reqwest-middleware` failed to compile for wasm32-unknown-unknown because these methods are missing.

Unless I am missing something, it should be safe to add these methods and let third party crates use them just like on native platforms.

title: Allow overriding the DNS resolver for the blocking client.
body: While there is the possibility to override the DNS resolver there is no way to enable it for the blocking client. This pull request adds the same "dns_resolver" function to the blocking client that the async client already has.

title: fix: Fix `log` dependency specification
body: The `log::log_enabled!` macro was added in version 0.4.6 of the crate. Hence, a version specification of 0.4 is insufficient. Fix it.

title: [src/blocking/client.rs] Fix warnings related to mutability of `self`
feat: add ClientBuilder::read_timeout(dur)
body: Closes #2237

title: Remove duplicate example for ClientBuilder::default_headers
body:
The code example is listed twice, once with marking a header as sensitive and once without.
I've removed the the example without the sensitive part.

title: fix: use lower case domain string when using resolve
body: Currently passing the domain with capital letters will never resolve.

title: feat: allow fine-grained root certs for rustls
body:
This adds two methods to `ClientBuilder`: `tls_built_in_webpki_certs(bool)` and `tls_built_in_native_certs(bool)`. After disabling `tls_built_in_root_certs(false)`, you can turn on just one set at runtime.

Closes #1848 
Closes #1843

title: fix: response body timeout forwards the size hint
body: Closes #2221

title: FromStr trait implementation for Name
body: Closes #2211

title: fix: accidentally set content-length to 0
body: closes #2202

title: fix: tls version limit for rustls
Fix binding interface when no tls is used
fix: Display for Error shouldn't include source
body: This was _supposed_ to be in 0.12 and forgotten. Getting it into 0.12.1 just a couple days after should be early enough.

title: fix extraction of server certificate out of rustls connection
body: In `reqwest@0.12` with `rustls` the `TlsInfo.peer_certificate()` returns only first 2 bytes of server's TLS certificate. This PR fixes extraction of the first TLS certificate out of the rustls connection.

title: fix: ask for h2 iff the `http2` feature is enabled
body: Closes #2192

title: refactor: Migrate trust-dns to hickory-dns
body:
Rebases #2001 

Closes #2001

title: Add macos-system-configuration feature flag
body:
Rebased #2080 onto 0.12-dev.

Closes #2080

title: feat: Make encoding_rs an optional feature
body:
Keeping it as a default feature so that the default user experience isn't to be confused about the lack of `text`. It is possible that `text` (but not `text_with_charset`) exists without the `encoding_rs` feature by only trying to decode the response as utf-8 in that case. However that would mean that the behaviour changes if the feature is later added since the method would start to respect `Content-Type` then.

Closes #1785

title: fix: Form::text on wasm setting octet-stream mime type and file name.
body:
Closes #1740, Closes #2002

Unfortunately JS's fetch API is somewhat limited and only supports two
options for multipart form data parts:
1) String with no file name and no mime type (which should be
interpreted as text/plain).
2) Blob with a file name ("blob" if not provided by the user) and a
mime type if provided by the user.

Until this commit, reqwest always used the latter option, so when a user
tried to add a text part with no file name, it would be sent with a mime
type of `application/octet-stream` and the filename "blob".

While we can't make the behaviour identical to the native
implementation, we can do a best-effort approach, using option (1) as
long as the user hasn't set a file name or a non plain text mime type.

title: Revert "fix: Patch `system-configuration` version (#2130)"
body: This reverts commit e639bdc1264c266a84dae3bae3193e07cae6861b.

title: revert: hyper v1 upgrade (for now)
body:
It seems a few things make it so this different strategy would be better: revert the breaking changes from master for now, and keep them in a `0.12-dev` branch.

- 0.11.25 broke the MSRV on macOS.
- The breaking changes aren't fully ready for 0.12 to go out, and I prefer keeping master ready to release with each commit.

**I don't mean this as a de-prioritization.** This just reflect reality and makes things easier to move forward. [Breaking changes](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/milestone/6) will still be worked on and merged into `0.12-dev`. As soon as they're all complete, we can rebase onto master and ideally release the same day (or next day).

title: Fix missing tokio/io-util
body:
https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/blob/037111f2fbd471e9c3c5b3815a5b10283b2729af/src/connect.rs#L756

This read needs the feature `tokio/io-util`. So `__tls` feature needs `tokio/io-util`

body: fix: not negotiate h2 when using native-tls backend with feature native-tls-alpn enabled.

This change bumps the `system-configuration` version. Preliminary local tests suggest this may fix #2006 .

This change inlines panic formatting for clarity. This will NOT work until the edition is changed to 2021, because panic used to treat strings without parameters as raw strings, not as format args.

See #2023

`cookie_store` and `cookie_provider` both enable the cookie store functionality; clarify the usage and potential for a custom store being overwritten if both are used.

Addresses #2105

title: Upgrading env_logger dep
body:
[`atty`](https://crates.io/crates/atty) is currently unmaintained and has a potential unsoundness vulnerability: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0145

`atty` is used by the following dependency tree:
```
Dependency tree:
atty 0.2.14
└── env_logger 0.8.4
    └── reqwest 0.11.23
```

[`env_logger`](https://crates.io/crates/env_logger) removed the `atty` dependency in the following pull request: https://github.com/rust-cli/env_logger/pull/248

This upgrades `env_logger` to version `^0.10` to resolve the issue.

title: feat: bump rustls to 0.22 for upgrading to hyper-v1
body:
This pr bump rustls, and make the branch compiling (not on all features, like `h3`)

It should help #2059

title: Update cookie crates
body:
Updated cookie crates to latest working with the cookie_store

Closes #1674

title: Remove `Sync` bound from `Body::wrap_stream`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/1969

By using [`SyncWrapper`](https://docs.rs/sync_wrapper/latest/sync_wrapper/struct.SyncWrapper.html) we can avoid requiring `Sync` for the stream passed to `Body::wrap_stream`. This makes it easier to use streams like axum's [`BodyDataStream`](https://docs.rs/axum-core/latest/axum_core/body/struct.BodyDataStream.html).

title: Fix HTTP/2: retry requests rejected with `REFUSED_STREAM`
body:
This patch gets the client to retry HTTP/2 requests rejected with `REFUSED_STREAM` by inspecting the error detail.

I found the issue with highly concurrent requests in HTTP/2 made to the server that is configured to allow the smaller number of concurrent streams. So for example, a client makes, say, 500 concurrent requests to an HTTP/2 server while the server's `max_concurrent_streams` is set to 100. In this case the client is allowed to initiate 500 concurrent streams _until_ the initial `SETTINGS` frame from the server reaches to the client, though the server will reject 400 streams by responding `REFUSED_STREAM`.
From the standpoint of users of `reqwest` crate, I would expect the crate to deal with this kind of situation behind the scenes. Actually, as far as I searched, Go and libcurl provides the retry logic when they encounter `REFUSED_STREAM`. Considering the "ergonomic, batteries-included" characteristic of `reqwest`, I believe automatic retry would be very nice to have.

Here's a repo containing reproducible code written in a couple different languages. It also has `rust-patched` code which demonstrates that this patch does fix the issue.
https://github.com/magurotuna/deno-fetch-h2-stream-error-repro

title: docs: add cfg notes about http3 builder methods
Reject redirects with invalid scheme
body: Reqwest checks the URI scheme to match either `"http"` or `"https"` before it makes the initial request. This check does not exist on redirects, so the request gets executed. It would be better to reject the redirect with the same error as it would reject an initial request.

title: Update README advice regarding OpenSSL
body:
Previously, the README suggested that only certain older versions of OpenSSL are supported. This is no longer accurate (e.g. OpenSSL 3 works), the better source of truth for supported versions is https://docs.rs/openssl.

Also adds clarity that OpenSSL can be vendored, useful if not installed on the host.

body: potential fix for #2061

title: Improve interoperability with http
hyper v1 upgrade

The upgrade process to hyper v1, which is tracked in #2039. This branch isn't compiling yet, which is why it's marked as a draft. But I'm doing it in pieces, and if someone wants to grab some while I'm distracted with other things, it's here.

Closes #2039

title: proxy: add support for proxy authentication with user-specified header values
Don't panic when parsing invalid Url to Uri
body:
This is an updated version of #1399. The changes I made to the original PR:

- Renamed `expect_uri` to `try_uri`. Now that it returns a result instead of panicking, this is more appropriate
- Replaced the existing `try_uri` function with this one (it only had one usage)
- Fixed a compile error in `retry_error`
- Added a test to cover this use case

Closes #668

title: `fn headers()` for wasm::multipart
body: Fixes #2035 by stealing two missing functions from the non-wasm part of the library.

title: Add Certificate::from_pem_bundle()
body:
Example where this could be used: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/config.html#httpcainfo

I chose not to use a path argument as requested in [#421](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/421) for the sake of WASM support.

PR does not make an attempt at solving [1858](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/1858), doing so would require the breaking API where certificates are passed directly to the corresponding certificate store.

title: chore: hide internal features
body:
This moves feature cleanup changes from #2023 

In `Cargo.toml`, hide all optional dependencies as features

Currently, reqwest publishes all optional dependencies as features - which is usually not what is intended. Instead, the features should be explicitly declared, whereas optional features are enabled with the new `dep:*` syntax.

Note that I also had to fix a few conditional compilations which used optional crates rather than features as conditionals.

Also, note the use of the `...?/...` syntax instead of `.../...` -- as this both enabled an optional crate AND adds a feature to it.  Now, it uses the `"dep:...", "...?/..."` syntax to prevent exposing crate name.

title: chore: Inline format args
body:
This makes the code a bit easier to read, and might result in a few minor perf optimizations (e.g. if Display trait is implemented, it might be better to make it part of the formatting). Also, i eliminated a few cases of using refs as format args - i.e. converted double-ref two single-ref, which is a 6% perf improvement (rustc cannot inline those for various reasons) - e.g. `format!("{}", &foo)` is more expensive than `format!("{}", foo)`.

All these changes are safe for both 2018 and 2021 editions.  The panic changes were moved to #2122

title: chore: migrate edition 2018 to 2021
body:
* Bump edition to 2021 on both crates
* Fix docs to use `Box<dyn ...>` (required)

P.S. So sad I missed the PR 2021 - would be symbolic to have edition 2021 migration as PR number 2021 :)

title: Fix 1.63.0 MSRV
body:
Unfortunately, #1955 broke MSRV 1.63.0 as the `let Some` syntax wasn't stabilized until 1.65.0.

This fixes the MSRV breakage on macOS.

As this had previously slipped the CI `msrv` test, the second commit now ensures we check MSRV on `macos-latest` and `windows-latest`, too.

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: Optimize `TrustDnsResolver`
body:
- Replace use of `tokio::sync::Mutex` with `once_cell::sync::OnceCell`
   since there's no need for it to be `async` and thus it can just use
   `OnceCell` instead of `Mutex`.
 - Optimize `TrustDnsResolver`: Rm use of `Lazy`
 - Optimize `TrustDnsResolver`: Rm unnecessary `Arc`
 - Derive `Default` on `TrustDnsResolver`

title: dep: Upgrade trust-dns-resolver from v0.22 to v0.23
Respect MacOS proxy settings
body:
This PR adds support to `reqwest` for respecting the system proxy settings for MacOS. It follows many of the same code paths as #547, which added support for system proxies on Windows. This does add a dependency on a new crate, `system-configuration`, for communicating with MacOS.

I did a little bit of renaming, mostly changing the word "registry" to "platform" to better communicate that the non-environment-variable proxy settings can come from different locations, depending on your target platform.

I tested this locally via a Rust app I work on (on Ventura 13.5.1), and verified that with these changes (and a local proxy server like Charles active), any requests are forwarded through the proxy. The no proxy case works as well.

title: Revert "Fix deflate decompression (#1927)"
body:
This reverts commit 839623312f8359b173437fb01b1932f204449cca.

See https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/pull/1927#issuecomment-1688397688

title: msrv: bump to 1.63
body: Tokio requires this.

title: Fix panic in building h3 client when udp is forbidden
body: Fixed #1942

title: connect timeout for multiple IPs
body: fixes #1939 and adds a regression test

title: Add `tls_info` / `TlsInfo` for access to peer's leaf certificate
body:
This adds a `HttpsInfo` extension into responses when configuring a client with `https_info(true)`.  The extension can be obtained by callers to get access to the peer's leaf certificate.  Works with both native and rustls TLS.  Fixes #1428.

Not sure if this is the best way to solve it, but it works, doesn't expose TLS connector specific types, and should not cause overhead unless enabled.  Happy to refactor and clean up as much as needed for this to go in.

title: Bump rustls to v0.21.6
body: Attempts to fix broken #1922 .

title: Fix deflate decompression
body:
This solve issue 1462 by using 'deflate' algo instead of 'zlib' algo to decompress responses with the 'deflate' Content-Encoding.

The full series of tests (cargo test) still works after this.

My code (see isseu #1462) now works, where I was getting " deflate decompression error" before my patch.

title: Add config option to set http1_ignore_invalid_headers_in_responses
